TopicTitle: Platform Enigma- an off topic chat thread.

Articles.Content:
We've been well behaved, though Odin! And it'll make for interesting read, if nothing else

Woohoo, 200th page!

That's the surprising part, I see no serious problems with today's activity.

Pardon me if I'm being stupid here, but wouldn't it be preferable to be a non-combat medic?

I would think that eventually you'd get tired of people making TF2 jokes about your choice of career. But really, combat medics have a lot of perks not found in other medical fields mainly related to the need to travel constantly to follow the frontlines.

Sorry about what happened Trekkette. Hopefully things turn around soon. In the meantime, have a drink and have some fun, just take care not to overdo it and leave any lasting effects.

Engineers are supposed to be Scottish. Nice try, though.

Does Irish count? Also Scotty is more of a maintenance man than an engineer. Although in my line of work I am often expected to fix the mistakes other engineers made in designing things so that the resulting piece of equipment stays reliable and performing well.

Just got done rewiring one of the machines at work, did the phasing checks on the motors this morning and ran the filter portion of it most of the day so it would settle down.

Sci-fi nerds gotta sstick together, regardless of franchise.

Also, given that JJ Abrams is directing the new Star Wars movie, and he's said in the past that all his movies take place in the same continuity, Star Trek and Star Wars will become related.

A long time ago, in a galaxy far far away...

Which ultimately, because Star Trek never actually leaves the Milky Way Galaxy, they may very well be in the same universe and are just so distant being galaxies apart that they have never encountered each other until cameos happened.

Sci-fi nerds gotta sstick together, regardless of franchise.

Also, given that JJ Abrams is directing the new Star Wars movie, and he's said in the past that all his movies take place in the same continuity, Star Trek and Star Wars will become related.

And there will be peace...

Like I said, I find Star Trek confusing. Can you do a brief explanation? Or is it really that complicated?
Is it too late to join the party?

Is it too late to join the party?

It is never too late. Lets go for three hundred!

Funny story about the earlier situation- I had a prolonged Facebook conversation with him, and we clarified a few points. Basically, the relationship has not crashed, but is in a holding pattern until one of us is independent of respective parental units. So all is good and I am happy.

EDIT

And there will be peace...

Like I said, I find Star Trek confusing. Can you do a brief explanation? Or is it really that complicated?

Umm... what's confusing about it? I can answer questions, but trying to explain it's 54 year history takes... time.

Star trek combined with star wars!?!? Fans will cause chaos.

Yay, Trekkette is happy again!

*Rolls over* :3

Also: DO NOT CROSS THE STREAMS (franchises)
*Tickles Rages tummy* Playful kitten!

I was thinking more about how a combat medic would actually have combat training as well. They expect you to shoot people, and I thought that went against the medical oath.

Scotty is actually an engineer, at least by sci-fi standards. Doubt a mere maintenance man could reverse the polarity of the flux capacitors to accomplish whatever needs to happen.
Everyone forgot I was a cat, and now Rage gets all the attention...

Star trek combined with star wars!?!? Fans will cause chaos.

Yay, Trekkette is happy again!

Star Wars fans and Trekkies will start to fight. Quick, hide in very deep underground nuclear bunkers with 10 mile thick walls!

Wait a sec...

Rage is a kitty, Rockcoole's a kitty, ROFLCopter's always been a kitty....

*is now crazy cat lady of the Junkyard!!*

Everyone forgot I was a cat, and now Rage gets all the attention...

Well, no because Ragebot just had a major mind glitch and has the personality of a kitten.

*playfully batts at the hand that tickled him*

Funny story about the earlier situation- I had a prolonged Facebook conversation with him, and we clarified a few points. Basically, the relationship has not crashed, but is in a holding pattern until one of us is independent of respective parental units. So all is good and I am happy.

EDIT

Umm... what's confusing about it? I can answer questions, but trying to explain it's 54 year history takes... time.

Good point. The episode I most remember confused me the most:

Some guy messes up really bad and dies. God appears and sends him back in time to give him a second chance, a la Groundhog Day. He still screws up, and God isn't as forgiving this time. I stopped watching around here. Do you know which episode I'm talking about?
But still, no one has mentioned that I am a cat for a while.

Wait a sec...

Rage is a kitty, Rockcoole's a kitty, ROFLCopter's always been a kitty....

*is now crazy cat lady of the Junkyard!!*

I am secretly the cat in charge of the chaos. Muhahaha

This is me, crazed on power! Muhahahahahahhahah!

I was thinking more about how a combat medic would actually have combat training as well. They expect you to shoot people, and I thought that went against the medical oath.

No, combat medics are still just medics, except deployed into combat situations. We would be given rifles, but only for self-defense in very dire situations. Anyway, all medics, including combat deployed, are protected under chapter 4, article 25 of the Geneva Convention. Provided we're doing our duty, we can't be shot.

Sadly, insurgents don't often respect the Geneva convention, making us just as much a target.

I am secretly the cat in charge of the chaos. Muhahaha

This is me, crazed on power! Muhahahahahahhahah!

Harlem shake cat.

@roflcatmanVVdownthereVV: So? i'm still able to kill you by accidentally stepping on you. I am the possessor of metallic boots.

Edited June 3, 2013 by Rage097
I am Alpha Cat, because I was a cat first.

Good point. The episode I most remember confused me the most:

Some guy messes up really bad and dies. God appears and sends him back in time to give him a second chance, a la Groundhog Day. He still screws up, and God isn't as forgiving this time. I stopped watching around here. Do you know which episode I'm talking about?

Probably. Was the guy bald?

I am Alpha Cat, because I was a cat first.

I am the Omega cat, the cat to end all cats.
As soon I what every turned me into a kitty wears off I'll be right back to my Half-human-fox self :3 Until then I need to freak as many people out with the fact that I'm a talking cat.

Probably. Was the guy bald?

Probably, now that I think about it.

Honestly, I'd be more worried over the murricans and NATO conscripts you'd be with than those poor insurgents. They're the worst in the world at following things like the Geneva convention. I'll just sit here and desperately hope you get out of that occupation alive.

As soon I what every turned me into a kitty wears off I'll be right back to my Half-human-fox self :3 Until then I need to freak as many people out with the fact that I'm a talking cat.

*Batts at rockcoole, still not realizing he's a human-sized and shaped cyborg.*
